content.question: In the fourth paragraph, the author cites Thomas Friedman primarily to

choices.label: attribute the flawed assumptions of flat-world proponents to Friedman
acknowledge that the arguments of flat-world proponents are more complex than he has previously suggested
note a difference between the original version of the flat-world argument and popular adaptations of this argument
reveal his insights into the circumstances that inspired Friedman to invent the flat-world metaphor

content.answer: acknowledge that the arguments of flat-world proponents are more complex than he has previously suggested

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and explain claims and evidence within an argument.
